intro: Dissotidendron caloneurum var. pilosum, commonly known as the woolly dissotidendron, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, or pilose, leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens for its ornamental value.
